comment: Can't say much, because he literally did not interact with us at all. Does not respond to emails, and didn't grade any of our assignments until the last couple weeks, when he decided to just give out 100s with no feedback. Course content is old and from another professor. I still learned, but I have no idea what I'm doing right or wrong.

Machine Learning isn't an easy subject but Dr. Kang does a fairly good job breaking it down. On tests, a conceptual understanding is fine. So it's ok if you don't perfectly understand the complex math. Generous grader. Partial credit and extra credit. Not absolutely perfect English but his accent is ok. One of the better CS professors at KSU.

Tough Teacher! I really like Dr. Kang and have always graded him highly.  He is very hard but you learn loads.  My only reason for a less than stellar grade this semester is that I took Mobile app Development to learn mobile app development.  Instead we learned OpenCV, a worthwhile skill but not app development.  Normally a 5/5 but missed the mark.
He's willing to spend as much time as necessary answering students' questions in class. Also, his power points are great study materials and are easily available on his website.

While Kang assigns HW and Labs that are helpful in learning he is a fresh Phd student with no industry experience so his lecture can be very hard to follow and his test are difficult mainly because you don't know how they will be formatted and he gives no clues as to what you need to focus on. I did learn but not the worst prof but not the best.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His assignments are coding intensive and he only has a few of them worth lots of your grade.  He is a great guy and if you go to him for help he will give you any amount of help you need.  That said his lectures can be a little disorganized and hard to follow.  You will have to learn some on your own.  Good teacher, but poor lecturer.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: CS, by it's very nature, requires a good deal of practice, so your grade will be mainly influenced by the amount of time you spend coding. That being said,  Professor Kang is awesome! He's willing look at your code with you and show you specific places that you could improve. He explains things in simple terms and gives many examples for each topic
